title: Simon Cowell to replace Stern as judge on ‘America’s Got Talent’
text:
Simon Cowell to replace Stern as judge on ‘America’s Got Talent’ By Indo-Asian News Service on October 23, 2015 at 8:43 AM Comments 
Media mogul Simon Cowell will be taking over Howard Stern’s now-empty spot at the judges’ podium of ‘America’s Got Talent’ season 11. ”We’ve been talking about it for a few years, funny enough, me and NBC,” Cowell said that he and the network first discussed the job five years ago, but that it didn’t pan out at the time. 
“This year… Everything worked. So it was perfect,” he added. The reality TV personality, 56, is known for his unflinching honesty when it comes to critiquing performers. He previously judged “American Idol”, from its premiere in 2002 until he left in 2011 after nine seasons. 
Asked whether he will again show his tough side, he said, “I’m not going to lie to people when I think they’re hopeless, I just couldn’t do that! But no, of course I’m not going to be rude for the sake of being rude. That would be ridiculous. I’ll take it act by act.” 
Stern, 61, joined the popular NBC show in 2012 for Season 7, and stepped down after Season 10 concluded in September. AGT is hosted by Nick Cannon, and judged by Howie Mandel, Heidi Klum, and Mel B, though none have been officially confirmed for Season 11 yet. 
The show will be holding auditions for the upcoming season in many cities.
